task_summary: Perceive the T-shaped block, approach and align the circular end-effector, push the block toward the marked goal region, verify arrival, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed camera shows a tabletop with a red T-shaped block and a small circular goal mark on the right. A 6-DoF arm with a cylindrical/rounded tool approaches, makes contact, and pushes the block. The behavior tree performs perception with recovery scanning, moves above the object, aligns laterally for a push, executes one long push and, if needed, a short corrective push, then verifies the goal and retreats. Observation/control are conceptually 10 Hz but not parameterized in the node ports.
stepwise_plan: Ensure the T-block is visible or scan to localize it
Detect and refine pose; move above the block
Approach and align with tight tolerance; set yaw for side push
Execute a primary push toward the goal
If not at goal, perform a small corrective push
success_criteria: T-block comes to rest overlapping the goal region
No collisions with robot base or environment
Task completes without timeouts or repeated recovery loops
failure_and_recovery: Perception failure → spiral scan and retry
Minor misalignment/undershoot → corrective push via retry branch
Overshoot or slipping → additional short push attempts (bounded)
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when goal verification passes or when retries are exhausted.

frame_3.now_evidence: First clear contact and alignment of end-effector against the T-block.
frame_3.predicts_next: Sustained push expected in following frames.

frame_5.now_evidence: Block near goal; end-effector centered for terminal check/corrective push.

frame_2.now_evidence: Alignment nearly achieved, block pose stabilized in view.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Recovery scan if the block is not visible.
Run perception to get current pose of the T-block.
Lift above the block to a safe pre-push height.
Slide to align the end-effector with push face.
Checks if the block is currently visible.
Verifies that the target region is reached.
Back off to a safe pose after completion.

recovery_strategy: Small corrective push via retry branch
Abort after bounded retries and report
assumptions: Frames show a red T-block and a blue circular goal mark; instruction colors (gray/green) differ—frames were trusted.
Exact 10 Hz rates are not exposed via ports; timing handled by controller outside this BT.
Push direction assumed toward the right (0°) based on apparent motion.

expected_success_criteria: No collisions or table edge events
